summary: Email correspondence from a paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY transmitting exhibits related to Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application. The email indicates the exhibits were split into multiple parts due to file size constraints.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the renewed bail application; the exhibits being transmitted pertain to her legal case.

persons.name: Contractor
persons.context: Individual who initially sent the email with the bail application exhibits, but the file was too large.

events.title: Filing of Renewed Bail Motion
events.description: The defense filed a renewed motion for bail on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Transmission of Bail Exhibits
events.description: A paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office transmitted exhibits supporting Maxwell's renewed bail application via email, split into multiple parts due to file size.

locations.name: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY
locations.address: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007

keyFacts: The document is an email chain regarding the transmission of exhibits for Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application.
The exhibits were split into multiple parts (Part 1 and Part 2) due to the large file size of the initial transmission.
The correspondence originates from a Paralegal Specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The renewed bail motion was filed on December 8, 2020, indicating ongoing legal proceedings at that date.
The email demonstrates standard procedural communication between legal parties in a high-profile case.
